document.docAuthor: Nunes, Luis Gabriel de O. A., Nunes, Rafael V. & Vaz-De, Fernando Z.
document.docTitle: Canthon (Peltecanthon) terciae Nunes & Nunes & Vaz-De 2020, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the South American subgenus Canthon (Peltecanthon) Pereira, 1953 (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Scarabaeinae: Deltochilini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of the South American subgenus Canthon (Peltecanthon) Pereira, 1953 (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Scarabaeinae: Deltochilini)

mods:name.mods:namePart: Nunes, Luis Gabriel de O. A.

Ventral surface of meso- and metafemora. C. Transverse carina in the hypomeron. D. Carina in the margin between pygidium and propygidium. E. Male protibial spur. F. Paratype, ♀, Rio Grande do Norte, Baia Formosa, Mata Estrela (CEMT), protibial spur.

Parameres dorsal view. C. Internal sac ventral view. D. Internal sac dorsal view. Abbreviations: see Material and methods.

subSubSection.paragraph:
This species is named in honour of Dr Tercia Vargas dos Santos, who developed phylogeographical studies with the subgenus
Peltecanthon
and reinforced our taxonomic decision.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 7.
Canthon ( Peltecanthon ) terciae
sp. nov. , paratype, ♂, Rio Grande do Norte, Baia Formosa, Mata Estrela (CEMT). A . Dorsal habitus. B . Ventral surface of meso- and metafemora. C . Transverse carina in the hypomeron. D . Carina in the margin between pygidium and propygidium. E . Male protibial spur. F . Paratype, ♀, Rio Grande do Norte, Baia Formosa, Mata Estrela (CEMT), protibial spur.

subSubSection.paragraph: MEASUREMENTS. Body length (except the head): 10.0 mm, pronotum width: 7.0 mm.
ABDOMEN. Ventrite glabrous, chagrinated. Black and green.
PYGIDIUM. As wide as long. Red with bright green. Basal margin expanded, forming a strong carina in V-form between pygidium and propygidium.
PARAMERES. Flattened laterally. On lateral view, apical portion ventrally truncated, dorsally a little curve. In dorsal view, central membranous portion enlarged in the centre ( Fig. 8 A–B).

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 8.
Canthon ( Peltecanthon ) terciae
sp. nov. , paratype, ♂, Rio Grande do Norte, Baia Formosa, Mata Estrela (CEMT). A . Parameres lateral view. B . Parameres dorsal view. C . Internal sac ventral view. D . Internal sac dorsal view. Abbreviations: see Material and methods.

Fig. 9.
Canthon ( Peltecanthon ) terciae
sp. nov. , paratype, ♂, Rio Grande do Norte, Baia Formosa, Mata Estrela (CEMT). Position of the internal sac sclerites. A . Dorsal view. B . Ventral view. Abbreviations: see Material and methods.

subSubSection.paragraph: MORPHOLOGICAL VARIATION. Body length (except the head) ranges from 8.5 to 11.5 mm ; pronotum width from 6 to 7.5 mm . Colour: dorsally green with bright red. Legs: metafemoral ventral surface not completely smooth, with some punctures.

This new species is much more similar to
C. staigi
than to the other two species of
Peltecanthon
. The differences between them are very subtle, and there are great morphological similarities between them, in the main characters that differentiate the species of this subgenus; the main differences observed are in the sclerites of the internal sac (exactly in MP). In addition to the sclerite, these species (
C. staigi
and
C. terciae
sp. nov. ) can be differentiated only by the characters of the dorsal colour and base of the metafemur, without any need for dissection.
Northern Brazilian Atlantic Forest, in the states of Rio Grande do Norte , Paraíba , Pernambuco and Sergipe ( Fig. 10 ).
